newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber market ends mixed on holiday mood.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber market ends mixed on holiday mood.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices ended mixed after weak interest shown by players distracted by the approach of year-end holidays, traders said.
"It's the holiday mood," said a trader. "There's no real buying or selling going on, except maybe some hand-to-mouth short-covering."

At the close, the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board quoted January RSS1 buyer at 318.50 ($1.26) a kg, down half cent from Wednesday's close. January SMR 20 buyer was quoted half cent down at 308.50 cents.
Traders said business in December was usually slow, with the Christmas and New Year festivities distracting players.
Producers were, however, trying to hold to prices because rains in recent weeks have drastically reduced supply of raw materials into the market, said traders.
Trading houses were quoting the SMR 20 at 307 cents, SMR CV at 362, SMR L at 343, SMR 10 at 308, and drum latex at 236.
The INRO five-day moving average rose to 242.78 Malaysian/Singapore cents per kg on Dec 18 from 242.18 on Dec 17. The daily indicator price fell to 243.30 from 243.87.
